definition: animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
Yongzhen Reform, Tang dynasty failed reform movement of 805 led by Wang Shuwen 王叔文[Wang2 Shu1 wen2]

sentences.english: Arts and Humanities, we are told, are useless for the making of technological innovation.
sentences.chinese: 我们被教导说艺术与人文对于技术革新是无用的。

sentences.english: Vacuum continuous soakage on sweetmeat is grand reformation of sweetmeat processing.
sentences.chinese: 蜜饯的真空连续浸渍是蜜饯加工工艺的重大革新。

sentences.english: Finally, actuated the system to the car to carry on the innovation.
sentences.chinese: 对小车驱动系统进行了革新。

sentences.english: I pride myself on always thinking outside the box.
sentences.chinese: 我以自己常具创意革新的思维而感到自豪。

sentences.english: Now a mass movement to plant trees is in full swing all over the country.
sentences.chinese: 群众性的技术革新运动正在该厂蓬勃开展。

sentences.english: Those who are truly Schumpeterian will reform or revolutionize their industries.
sentences.chinese: 真正的熊彼特主义会在各自的行业进行革新或革命。

sentences.english: Multi-Probe Technique is an important revolution to the antenna near-field test technique.
sentences.chinese: 该技术是天线近场测量技术的一次重大革新。

sentences.english: The anticipated increase in sample numbers necessitates innovative technology solutions to achieve success.
sentences.chinese: 预期样本数的增加迫使技术革新以取得成功。

sentences.english: Youth, in particular, are seen as beacons of innovation and creativity.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人特别被看成是革新和创造的希望。

sentences.english: Toyota’s innovative efforts – including cleverer hybrids –will also be redoubled.
sentences.chinese: 丰田的革新努力措施，包括混合动力车，也将被加强。

sentences.english: This technical innovation will save us much time and labour.
sentences.chinese: 这项技术革新可以为我们节省大量的时间和劳力。

sentences.english: To come up with more creative and innovative designs?
sentences.chinese: 还是想出更原创性和革新性的设计？

sentences.english: Such a programme will be a novelty in India.
sentences.chinese: 在印度，这样的优惠卡机制无疑会是一次革新。

sentences.english: When the campaign for technical innovations started, he proposed three items.
sentences.chinese: 技术革新运动开始时，他提出了三项建议。

sentences.english: To avoid more tragedies, the inspector initiated an innovation.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免更多的悲剧，检查员发动了一项革新。

sentences.english: Traditional handicraft techniques are being steadily improved.
sentences.chinese: 传统的手工艺技术不断革新。

definition: innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
to topple (i.e. knock over)/to capsize/fig. to overturn (a regime, by plotting or subversion)/to undermine/to subvert
to push out the old and bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate
